intro: Isolepis berlandieri, commonly known as the desert flatsedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Isolepis berlandieri plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
